item.title: Proxmox VE Full Desktop Installation
item.description: Step 1: Install Proxmox & Configure Logical Volumes Link to heading FIrst install proxmox in Boot Drive By default, Proxmox creates two Logical Volumes, I would recommend using all your disk space in a single Logical Volume especially if you are planning to use your Proxmox as a full Desktop with a user interface and GUI applications, or if you have a small Boot Disk. To use the full Boot Drive as a single logical volume, increase the “local” volume storage size by first deleting the “local-lvm” volume on the Proxmox user Interface.
